commits.author: Michael Arnoldus <ma@goodmonday.io>
commits.summary: Add comprehensive implementation plan for Build History feature
commits.fullMessage:
Created detailed implementation plan for a new "Byggehistorik" (Build History) feature that will display how this site was built using AI assistance.

Plan includes:
- Feature overview and architecture decisions
- Data structure for commits (SHA, author, timestamp, summary, full message, prompts)
- Git extraction strategy to create build-history.json
- 5 implementation phases with detailed steps:
  - Phase 1: Data extraction and JSON file creation
  - Phase 2: TypeScript models and data loading
  - Phase 3: Build history components (container + list item)
  - Phase 4: Navigation integration (3rd tab)
  - Phase 5: Styling and polish
- Component architecture following existing patterns
- TypeScript interfaces for Commit and BuildHistory
- Styling guidelines with phase badge color scheme
- Testing checklist and accessibility requirements
- Timeline estimate: 2.5-4 hours

The feature will showcase the meta-demonstration aspect by displaying all git commits with their AI prompts, providing transparency and educational value for workshop participants.
commits.prompt: Let's create a new top level item that will display how this site was built. Do this by extracting all commit message and convert to a JSON file. For each commit we should have - The commit SHA so we can regognise which commit we already have in the list when we need to update - The full commit message - A nice summary, 1-2 lines - A timestamp. Build a page that will show a list of the summaries with timestamp and a way to open each summary to see all details. Write a plan for building this in @doc

commits.author: Michael Arnoldus <ma@goodmonday.io>
commits.summary: Configure angular.json to serve src/assets directory
commits.fullMessage:
Issue:
The content.json file was not accessible at /assets/content.json because angular.json was only configured to serve assets from the "public" folder, but our content was in "src/assets/".

Fix:
Added src/assets to the assets configuration in angular.json:
- Input: "src/assets"
- Output: "/assets/"
- Glob: "**/*"

This ensures content.json and all images in src/assets/images/ are properly served by the Angular dev server.

Verified:
- http://localhost:4200/assets/content.json now returns the JSON content
- All 10 slides are accessible
- Dev server builds successfully

commits.summary: Phase 2 - Slides feature with keyboard navigation and presentation mode
commits.fullMessage:
Implemented:
- Created SlidesStateService:
  - Manages current slide index with BehaviorSubject
  - Provides observables: currentSlide$, currentIndex$, totalSlides$
  - Navigation methods: next(), previous(), goToSlide(), reset()
  - Bounds checking to prevent out-of-range navigation

- Created KeyboardNavigationService:
  - Listens for ArrowLeft/ArrowRight keyboard events
  - Emits 'next' or 'previous' navigation directions
  - Prevents default scroll behavior on arrow keys
  - Can be started/stopped programmatically

- Created SlidesContainerComponent:
  - Integrated slide display, progress indicator, and navigation buttons
  - Subscribes to keyboard navigation events
  - Uses async pipe for reactive updates
  - Features:
    * Large, readable slide title and keywords
    * Professional image styling with borders and shadows
    * Collapsible details section using <details> element
    * Progress counter (e.g., "3/10")
    * Visual progress bar with gradient
    * Navigation buttons with disabled states
    * Keyboard hint text in Danish
    * Responsive design for mobile, tablet, desktop
    * Fullscreen presentation mode support

- Updated App component:
  - Replaced Angular boilerplate with slides container
  - Imports SlidesContainerComponent
  - Clean, minimal app template

- Styling highlights:
  - Large fonts for projector visibility (3rem title, 1.8rem keywords)
  - High contrast colors for readability
  - Professional image presentation with shadows
  - Smooth transitions and animations
  - Mobile-responsive breakpoints
  - Support for screens up to 1400px+ (4rem title)

- Tested successfully:
  - Build compiles without errors
  - Bundle size: 28.10 kB (optimized)
  - Dev server runs on http://localhost:4201/
